data.title: Louis Protano
data.info: Born in London, raised in Sheffield. I'm both creative and technical. I have a love for design and always have a project on the go. I studied Visual Communication at Chesterfield College in 2013, then went on to study Games Art and Design at Norwich University of the Arts 2014 - 2017. Since then I've been working as an indie game dev and all-round creative.

data.title: Liberty Captain
data.subtitle: Ghastlies
data.info: A lone voyager seeks salvation

data.title: Quadropus of the Cosmos
data.subtitle: Ghastlies
data.info: Based on a drawing I did a few years prior. This was my first blender project so you can see the animations are still a little bit rigid, that said I was glad to have developed the cute, jelly-like visuals that became a staple of my work moving forward
data.image0Alt: animated ghostly four legged octopus in space
data.image1Alt: animated ghostly four legged octopus in space

data.title: Neon Parasite
data.info: INFEST YOUR FRIENDS! Neon Parasite is a game of chaotic critter combat where you'll be hovering, shooting, and dashing your way around the competition to reign the most infested bug of all. This 4-player local party game boasts crazy strategic battles across a multitude of different arenas.
data.image0Alt: Cover art for Neon Parasite game
data.image1Alt: Screenshot from Neon Parasite - Swamp Station
data.image2Alt: A friendly and really cool floating pixel-art skull
data.image3Alt: Screenshot from Neon Parasite - Belly of the Beast
data.image1Info: Fight through sludge in Swamp Station
data.image3Info: Avoid Being Digested in the Belly of the Beast

data.title: Results Screen
data.subtitle: HTML, CSS
data.info: Made as part of the Coding Skills Bootcamp at IO-Academy. Our task was to recreate a brain training results screen from a provided image with both 'wide', and 'mobile' views

data.title: Children of Xolotl
data.info: A series of eight Axolotles modelled rigged, and animated in blender. I experimented with geometry nodes to create animated textures
data.linkTitle: See the full collection on Artstation

data.title: Doll House
data.info: A procedural storytelling game about subverting the lives of dolls. Made in Unreal Engine 4 as part of a six-week game jam with four other students. I was the producer, game designer, programmer, and art director. The prototype has a day/night cycle with the full version to include customization and cannibalism
data.image1Info: Move dolls from room to room. They've got favourite rooms, friends, and activities.
data.image2Info: Family Photo. DONT let them get too hungry...
data.image3Info: Listen to smooth jazz in your radioactive basement
data.linkTitle: Read about the development on Blogger

data.title: Stock Trader
data.info: A personal self-taught python project - A text-based stock trading game based off the Animal Crossing turnip market where you have to try and out-pace your increasing rent by buying/selling fruit. It runs fully in the terminal.
data.image1Info: The game features random stock changes and a game-over screen for running out of money
data.image2Info: I defined all the functions up-front and then called them from within the main game-loop
data.image3Info: The game runs in a series of while-loops and has exceptions for wrong answers

data.title: This Website
data.info: Developed in HTML, CSS, and Javascript with projects and columns automatically populated from a separate json file. The page is fully responsive and works in both wide and mobile views. Try it!
data.image1Info: It's the same but somehow different...

data.title: StarNinja vs SpaceHydra
data.info:
StarNinja Vs SpaceHydra was developed over 2 days for Ludum Dare 34 where the theme was '2 button controls'.
Based off of an older prototype about a cowboy shootout, I wanted to try simplifying the controls whilst combining both the shooting and the reflecting game modes all packaged as a single-player arcade game.
This game was one of the major milestones in developing Neon Parasite (2020) and features early versions of the air jumping, hydra boss, and timed reflectors (tied to the shoot button).
data.image1Info: JUMP, HOVER, and REFLECT as the hydra upgrades with each head you remove
data.image2Info: The title card I mocked up for the jam

data.title: Must Mine Deeper
data.info:
In this survival horror game, explore zombie infested, destructible caves, armed with only your trusty flashlight and revolver. 
 Mine gold and buy upgrades from the shop keeper, as each floor is more difficult than the last
Made in 6 weeks using Unreal Engine 4
data.image1Info: Limited ammo in the chamber so use it wisely. Explore the map for ammo and gold to spend between floors
data.image2Info: Don't get caught! Different zombie types require new strategies to beat

data.title: Moon Raider: First Landing
data.info: A procedurally generated, 2.5 button arcade game you can play in your web browser. Compete to achieve the highest score
data.image1Info: The game uses procedural generation to dynamically create challenges on the fly
data.image2Info: You always start with the same few blocks so as to introduce the basic mechanics
data.image3Info: Keep track of your highscores and compete for a better time
data.linkTitle: Try out the game on OBJKT

data.title: Email Client Front-end
data.info: A mockup email client frontend made to brief with React and Tailwind as part of a team during my time studying at iO Academy. The frontend GETs and POSTs data to a separate API using webhooks.
data.linkTitle: Check out the project on github

data.title: Quiz App Backend
data.info: A quiz app backend made with PHP and Laravel as part of a team during my time studying at iO Academy. The quizzes and associated answers are pushed to a MySQL database.
data.image1Info: Make a new quiz with title and description
data.image2Info: Add a new question and its point value. Then add multiple answers checking which one is correct.
data.image3Info: The finished quiz with answers pulled from a live mySQL database
data.linkTitle: Check out the project on github

data.title: Robot Store Frontend PHP Project
data.info: A robot store made with PHP which connects to a json file for it's data. Each item is stored in an array and sorted additively based on checkbox options.
data.image2Info: Additive sorting based on checked options
data.image3Info: Click through to individual pages to see more info
data.linkTitle: Check out the project on github

data.title: Dog Data Website
data.info: A dog data website built with basic html, css, and js. It uses an ajax request to access the local json data.
data.image1Info: The data is grouped and displayed using flexbox
data.image2Info: You can change the unit type with the button at the bottom right
data.linkTitle: Check out the project on github

data.title: Furniture Store Backend
data.info: A furniture store backend built in PHP and Laravel. Connects to a MySQL database to get the data. Built in a team at iO Academy.
data.image1Info: The numbers in green show how many of each type of item there are in the db
data.image2Info: The colours are stored in the database as a separate table and then linked in Laravel using an SQL query
data.image3Info: Different categories make new requests to the database.
data.linkTitle: Check out the project on github

data.title: Just Another Day
data.info: Race against the clock in this co-operative tree sawing game. Made using Game Maker: Studio in a team of 5 over 3 days for Brains Eden, Cambridge. I was the programmer and game designer, with the rest of the team working on story and artwork. Controller Required.

data.title: Procedural Silhouette Generator
data.info: Built over a few days in Game Maker as a tool for concept artists. Used by over 600 people

data.title: Parasite Story
data.info: Made for the GMTK gamejam 2020. I wanted to explore storytelling through dynamic music and game mechanics. I created bars of music on acoustic guitar, and programmed it to flow seamlessly between bars based on player progression. The game follows the story of a lonely parasite
